article.headline: Southeastern Louisiana 73, William Carey 50
article.story: HAMMOND, La. (AP) -- Daryl Cohen scored 23 of his career-high 26 points in the first half, including the first 18 of the game, and Southeastern Louisiana posted its first 4-0 start in 40 years as they cruised to a 73-50 home-opening win over William Carey on Saturday. Quennell Green added 13 points as Southeastern matched its best start since 1966-67, which began with an 89-88 win at LSU on Dec. 1, 1966. Southeastern shot a season-high 52 percent (29-for-56) from the floor and made eight 3-pointers. The Lions trailed 6-3 early in the game after an Andrae Leslie jumper before rallying back and eventually taking the lead for good, 15-12, on a 3-pointer by Cohen, a senior who finished 9-for-16 from the floor and 6-of-13 from behind the 3-point line. Cohen's go-ahead bucket started a 21-2 Southeastern run, capped by his three-point play with 4:22 left in the first half that gave the Lions a 33-14 lead. NAIA member William Carey (1-2), which went 2-for-13 from the floor with six turnovers during an 8:58 span, never got closer than 13 points the rest of the way as Southeastern built a 69-42 lead on a jumper by Kevyn Green with 4:07 left. Jeremy Holder led William Carey with 16 points and 11 rebounds, while Alex Eberle added 11 points and nine board in his first start for the Crusaders. William Carey shot 30 percent from the floor (17-for-57) and went 2-for-14 from behind the 3-point arc.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
